The duration in seconds of the feat's effect

A perk can be of three types: 
- %c[orange]ARCHETYPE%c[white]: a full fledged class perk with active feats. NPCs have a chance to spawn with it and only with one. 
- %c[orange]MAIN%c[white]: a major perk with one or more feats but no active ones. NPCs can have at most 2 main perks. 
- %c[orange]SECONDARY%c[white]: a minor perk with a single feat, it cannot be active. NPC always have 2 secondary perks.
Chance for an NPC to spawn with this perk

A feat can be of several types: 
- %c[orange]ACTIVE%c[white]: an active feat is activated on player command or automatically. It has a cooldown. 
- %c[orange]PASSIVE%c[white]: a passive feat is in effect only when its conditions applies. 
- %c[orange]BOON%c[white]: a one-time reward/boon that is given to the npc upon rolling this perk. NPC can have only have 1 boon. 
- %c[orange]TRAIT%c[white]: a feat with both positive and negative effects. NPC can have only have 1 trait. 
- %c[orange]MUTATION%c[white]: a feat that affects another feat, mainly by changing its properties and effects.

A feat can mode can be of several types: 
- %c[orange]AUTO%c[white]: automatically activated based on the feat's own conditions. 
- %c[orange]MANUAL%c[white]: manually activated by the player with an input key. The effect is triggered upon activation with a cooldown. 
- %c[orange]MODAL%c[white]: manually activated by the player with an input key. The effect is applied if the modal is on, disabled when it's off.
